intro: Genetyllis speciosa, commonly known as the showy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Genetyllis speciosa is a perennial herb that produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind.
